    • Constructor Detail

      • LoginController

        LoginController​(UserRepository userRepository,
                TokenRepository tokenRepository)
        Parameters:
        userRepository - Repository that holds all registered Users (injected)
        tokenRepository - Repository that holds all tokens of currently active Users (injected) using constructor injection (Dependency injection) meaning this constructor is typically not used manually.

    • Method Detail

      • login

        @PostMapping("/login")
TokenDTO login​(@RequestBody
               LoginDTO loginData)
        throws LoginFailedException
        User login to validate request from the client by receiving DTO containing username and the password
        Parameters:
        loginData - holds username and password of the user trying to log in
        Returns:
        the token the client uses to authenticate during request
        Throws:
        LoginFailedException - if username or password do not match the user saved in the database

      • logout

        @DeleteMapping("/login")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> logout​(@RequestHeader("userId")
                                                                 java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                 @RequestHeader("token")
                                                                 java.lang.String token)
        User logout so client can not make forbidden requests until new user logs in
        Parameters:
        userId - of the requesting user
        token - of the requesting user, used to validate his login status
        Returns:
        Response that logging out was successful or unsuccessful
